unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Film Festival! Your Guide to the Indie Scene, Desi Style
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Film Festival! Your Guide to the Indie Scene, Desi Style

unnormalised: Okay, Bollywood fans, time to step outside the regular Friday release and dive into something a little…different. I'm talking film festivals! Forget your typical Karan Johar romance (although, no shade!), film fests are where you discover the real gems, the stories that stick with you long after the credits roll.
normalised: Okay, Bollywood fans, time to step outside the regular Friday release and dive into something a little…different. I'm talking film festivals! Forget your typical Karan Johar romance (although, no shade!), film fests are where you discover the real gems, the stories that stick with you long after the credits roll.

unnormalised: Think of it as a mela for movies. You've got everything: world premieres, short films that pack a punch, documentaries that make you think, and of course, crazy Q&A sessions with directors and actors you've probably never heard of, but will soon be obsessed with.
normalised: Think of it as a mela for movies. You've got everything: world premieres, short films that pack a punch, documentaries that make you think, and of course, crazy Q and A sessions with directors and actors you've probably never heard of, but will soon be obsessed with.

unnormalised: India has a ton of awesome film festivals. We're talking the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, which is HUGE, then there's the Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI), Dharamshala International Film Festival (DIFF) nestled in the Himalayas - imagine the views! There are also smaller, regional festivals, all showcasing diverse voices and perspectives.
normalised: India has a ton of awesome film festivals. We're talking the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa, which is huge, then there's the Mumbai Film Festival (M A M I), Dharamshala International Film Festival (D I F F) nestled in the Himalayas - imagine the views! There are also smaller, regional festivals, all showcasing diverse voices and perspectives.

unnormalised: Why should you go? Well, for starters, it's a chance to see films you wouldn't find in your local PVR. Secondly, it's a great way to support independent filmmakers. These guys are working on shoestring budgets, pouring their hearts and souls into these projects. Your Rs. 200 ticket makes a HUGE difference.

unnormalised: Plus, let's be honest, the vibes are amazing. Imagine bumping into like-minded movie buffs, debating the merits of a 15 km long shot, or discovering the next Anurag Kashyap before everyone else does.
normalised: Plus, let's be honest, the vibes are amazing. Imagine bumping into like-minded movie buffs, debating the merits of a fifteen kilometer long shot, or discovering the next Anurag Kashyap before everyone else does.

unnormalised: So, next time you're scrolling through BookMyShow, give a film festival a try. You might just find your next favourite movie (and bragging rights that you saw it first!). Check out the IFTDA (Indian Film and Television Directors’ Association) website for details on festivals happening near you. Trust me, it's an experience worth having! You'll be discussing plot twists and camera angles for days.
